messages.text:
Hi, I'm Alexander, an astrophysics PhD student in Moscow. I use Julia in my everyday work starting from its first 1.0 release. It basically replaced Python for me pretty fast, except for code we write together with colleagues - almost no one around uses Julia...
If anyone curious :slightly_smiling_face:, I mostly study quasars using radio telescopes as the main workhorse. Other instruments such as neutrino telescopes come up as well from time to time (like now).

Please help me and show me direction towards starting my journey to the open-source contribution. Thanks!

messages.text: Hello, I'm a biologist (postdoc) at Massachusetts General Hospital. I've been using Julia for about a year on my computational project analyzing superresolution microscopy data after I realized how slow MATLAB was (parsing strings when passing arguments was taking up so much processing power!). I developed an ANOVA package (SimpleANOVA.jl), and I've also got a PR pending for Julia to provide for an n-dimensional array concatenation syntax.

elements.text: Hello, I'm a biologist (postdoc) at Massachusetts General Hospital. I've been using Julia for about a year on my computational project analyzing superresolution microscopy data after I realized how slow MATLAB was (parsing strings when passing arguments was taking up so much processing power!). I developed an ANOVA package (SimpleANOVA.jl), and I've also got a PR pending for Julia to provide for an n-dimensional array concatenation syntax.

Hello Everyone, I am Gautam Batra Senior Year Undergraduate from Indian Institute of Technology Dhanbad, I want to pursue research and my area of interest is of using ML in Computational mechanics problems. With that aim, I plan to move ahead, Previously worked on the FEA domain of Fracture Mechanics problem.
Glad to join this slack
Thanks <@U69BL50BF> sir

messages.text: :wave: Hello everyone! I am Guillaume, newly appointed assistant professor at University of Montreal. Learned about Julia through multiple colleagues (including <@UPSUNJN91>) and now taking the occasion of starting my own lab <http://www.ppsp.team|www.ppsp.team> to transition from Python :unpython: to Julia :juliaheartpulse:.

messages.text: Hello all! I was just brought on to CIRES/NOAA’s Global Systems Laboratory to work on evaluating Julia in comparison to the existing Fortran and C++ code currently used to run their weather models. I’m new to Julia (and scientific computing), so I’m happy this group is in existence, and hope to get involved/ask questions in due time! :wave:

messages.text: Hi everyone! I am a Data Scientist for <https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Wikidata:Main_Page|Wikidata, >hold a Phd in Psychology (Cognition), R/Big Data specialist, researcher in decision theory, causal induction, categorization, and reasoning, and pretty much new to Julia but learning and already enjoying it very much! I also run a Data Science and Analytics consultancy firm <https://www.datakolektiv.com/|DataKolektiv> from Belgrade.

messages.text: Hello folks! I am Tejas working with Amazon on problems in the geospatial space.  Looking to use Julia as an alternative to python for high speed data processing. Once I get used to it, might want to start looking at ML packages as well.

messages.text: Hey everyone, I’m Brady! I’m a front end developer with a background in physics and math, and I’m interested in helping people (including myself) build intuition for physics and math concepts using accessible, interactive visuals. I finally decided to learn Julia after getting fed up with JavaScript while working on an ODE solver, and realizing that Julia solves most of the problems I ran up against. My hope is to eventually use Julia as a back end for accessible, animated learning apps in the browser.

elements.text: Hey everyone, I’m Brady! I’m a front end developer with a background in physics and math, and I’m interested in helping people (including myself) build intuition for physics and math concepts using accessible, interactive visuals. I finally decided to learn Julia after getting fed up with JavaScript while working on an ODE solver, and realizing that Julia solves most of the problems I ran up against. My hope is to eventually use Julia as a back end for accessible, animated learning apps in the browser.

messages.text: Hello everyone, I'm a curious coder who is forever in love with mathematics and I've found my way to Julia. I will be starting UC Berkeley MIDS program this month and wanted to start working with Julia and contributing to the community. I have forked the repo on GitHub and have watched all the open training <https://julialang.org/learning/>. Any advice to help get started is valued!

attachments.title: Get started with Julia
attachments.text: The official website for the Julia Language. Julia is a language that is fast, dynamic, easy to use, and open source. Click here to learn more.

messages.text: Hi everyone! I'm Alvaro, currently a quantitative researcher in finance with a background in math and economics. Been using Julia for some projects lately and wrote a blog post on Vox EU about comparing it to the other main econ programming languages, <https://voxeu.org/article/which-programming-language-best-economic-research|you can find it here>. Excited to be a part of this community.

attachments.title: Which programming language is best for economic research?
attachments.text: The most widely used programming languages for economic research are Julia, Matlab, Python and R. This column uses three criteria to compare the languages: the power of available libraries, the speed
attachments.fallback: Which programming language is best for economic research?

you can find it here
. Excited to be a part of this community.
